abstract: A type identifier for records of clinical notes.
overview:
## Discussion

Clinical notes can have one or more attached files. While these files are often PDFs, HTML, or text files, they can be any format. Check the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAttachment] object’s [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAttachment/contentType] property to determine the file type. For more information on accessing the attachments, see [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAttachment].

If your app has permission to read [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKClinicalTypeIdentifier/clinicalNoteRecord] samples, it can also access the attachments. For more information on reading clinical note records, see [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/accessing-health-records].

# clinicalNoteRecord

**Type Property**

A type identifier for records of clinical notes.

## Declaration

```swift
static let clinicalNoteRecord: HKClinicalTypeIdentifier
```

## Discussion

Clinical notes can have one or more attached files. While these files are often PDFs, HTML, or text files, they can be any format. Check the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAttachment] object’s [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAttachment/contentType] property to determine the file type. For more information on accessing the attachments, see [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAttachment].

If your app has permission to read [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKClinicalTypeIdentifier/clinicalNoteRecord] samples, it can also access the attachments. For more information on reading clinical note records, see [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/accessing-health-records].

## Related Documentation

- **HKClinicalType**: A type that identifies samples that contain clinical record data.
- **documentReference**: A type that identifies FHIR resources for document references.
- **diagnosticReport**: A type that identifies FHIR resources for findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests.

## Clinical Record Type Identifiers

- **allergyRecord**: A type identifier for records of allergic or intolerant reactions.
- **conditionRecord**: A type identifier for records of a condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event.
- **immunizationRecord**: A type identifier for records of the current or historical administration of vaccines.
- **labResultRecord**: A type identifier for records of lab results.
- **medicationRecord**: A type identifier for records of medication.
- **procedureRecord**: A type identifier for records of procedures.
- **vitalSignRecord**: A type identifier for records of vital signs.
- **coverageRecord**: A type identifier for records containing information about the user’s insurance coverage.
